title: Fix logo asset paths and add resilient logo fallbacks

requirements.summary: Ensure the logo static asset exists and all logo references use the canonical path centralized in brandAssets.
acceptanceCriteria: The logo image loads successfully (no broken-image icon) in the SiteHeader, SiteFooter, HomePage hero, and LogoMotif components.
BRAND_ASSETS.logo in frontend/src/lib/brandAssets.ts points to a file that exists under the frontendâ€™s publicly served static assets (e.g., /assets/generated/...).
Hard-refreshing the deployed site still shows the logo (not dependent on cache).

file_operations.description: Add the canonical generated logo asset so BRAND_ASSETS.logo can reference an existing publicly served file (source: generated/taste-tales-logo.dim_512x512.png).
Add the canonical generated favicon asset so BRAND_ASSETS.favicon and index.html can reference an existing publicly served file (source: generated/taste-tales-favicon.dim_64x64.png).

Update BRAND_ASSETS.logo to the existing canonical path /assets/generated/taste-tales-logo.dim_512x512.png (currently points to a non-existent taste-tales-logo-uploaded file) and confirm favicon/hero paths match existing assets.
Ensure all logo references use the centralized BRAND_ASSETS.logo (no hardcoded or stale filenames) in both desktop and mobile header logo areas.
Ensure the footer logo references use the centralized BRAND_ASSETS.logo (no hardcoded or stale filenames).
Ensure the HomePage hero logo references use the centralized BRAND_ASSETS.logo (no hardcoded or stale filenames).
Ensure the LogoMotif decorative logo uses the centralized BRAND_ASSETS.logo (no hardcoded or stale filenames).

requirements.summary: Add resilient fallbacks for logo images so failed loads show a clean brand mark without layout breakage.
acceptanceCriteria: If the logo image fails to load, the header/footer/hero do not show a broken-image icon and instead show a clean fallback while preserving spacing/alignment.
When the logo loads normally, no fallback is visible and the UI matches the intended design.

file_operations.description: Create a shared BrandLogo component that renders the logo using BRAND_ASSETS.logo and provides an onError-driven fallback (e.g., text mark or inline SVG) while preserving the same sizing/box dimensions as the image.
Replace direct logo usage with the shared BrandLogo component in both desktop and mobile header to prevent broken-image icons and preserve layout.
Replace direct logo usage with the shared BrandLogo component in the footer to provide a consistent fallback and avoid layout shifts.
Replace the hero logo with the shared BrandLogo component so the hero shows a clean fallback if the logo fails to load, without breaking spacing/alignment.
Update LogoMotif to use the shared BrandLogo component (or equivalent fallback logic) with the existing decorative opacity styling, ensuring no broken-image icon appears if loading fails.

requirements.summary: Align SEO/social meta image references in index.html to the canonical, existing logo asset path while keeping favicon valid.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html og:image and twitter:image reference a valid, existing asset path that returns the image successfully.
Favicon reference remains valid and loads correctly in the browser tab.

file_operations.description: Update og:image and twitter:image to reference the canonical existing logo asset path /assets/generated/taste-tales-logo.dim_512x512.png, and confirm the favicon link continues to reference a valid existing asset (/assets/generated/taste-tales-favicon.dim_64x64.png).
